entries.content: When a prospect needs to talk to their wife, explore what they think their wife will say about the proposed follow-up conversation.
entries.notes: Suggested by commentator as a way to handle the 'talk to the wife' objection and prep the conversation.

entries.content: Use a conditional close: 'Why don't we pencil something in... that way you have time to go run it by your wife and then we can reconnect... and see if we're still on fair enough?'
entries.notes: Agent's attempt at a conditional close, criticized by commentator.

entries.content: Avoid 'strong-arming' or subtly twisting the prospect's arm into the next step, as it leads to low commitment and high back-out rates.
entries.notes: Commentator's criticism of the agent's closing approach.

entries.content: Use a conditional close to get the prospect to ask for the meeting: 'Let's pretend you believed I have a solution and thought if we met I could fix your problem, what would you want to do?'
Never let on that you need the sale more than the prospect needs your solution. Avoid begging for the appointment.
entries.notes: Commentator's point about maintaining leverage and avoiding desperation at the close.

focus_area: Handling "Think About It": "What specifically?", Conditional closing
